Articles.Content: a challenge with story: you have some rich housing marketers and landlords that'll invest BILLIONS. but before they'll invest they tell you: "The housing market is going crazy. A house worth 6 months pay 5 years ago now costs 40 years pay and we want YOU to fix it. We want you to expand the housing market to other planets. We'll invest in you space program but you need to prove that you're capable of this expansion. If you can launch a REAL 4 kerbal house, and not a silly looking base but a real looking house to the mun then we will invest that 2 billion kerbucks and start planning for the expansion. AND if you can launch a 6 kerbal house, again realistic looking to a planet, other than kerban of course. Then we will invest triple that and give you half of the houses you land to own, as well as paying for getting the houses there. We'll even pay double that if you can get it to eeloo." That's exactly what they said and its you job to complete it. Unless you DON'T want that 2 or 6 or 12! billion kerbucks and chance to own half of all the housing outside of kerbin. good luck:)﻿

I have literally no idea what this challenge is. 

Oh and paragraphs are your friend.

Oh goody, a two-part challenge!

 

 

Part one: Figure out just what the OP is saying in that wall of text

Part two: do it.

2 hours ago, rockets-don't-make-toast said:

If you can launch a REAL 4 kerbal house, and not a silly looking base but a real looking house to the mun then we will invest that 2 billion kerbucks and start planning for the expansion. AND if you can launch a 6 kerbal house, again realistic looking to a planet, other than kerban of course. Then we will invest triple that and give you half of the houses you land to own, as well as paying for getting the houses there. We'll even pay double that if you can get it to eeloo

I think this is the main idea of the challenge...
Put a homestead on another planet? That actually sounds pretty cool.
i actually posted this challenge to a youtube video comments sections for the youtuber to do. but then i thought it would be a good forums challenge so i found the comment and copy pasted.

3 hours ago, rockets-don't-make-toast said:

youtube video comments sections

That explains a lot actually. So does this.

The challenge appears to be interesting as far as I can tell. But honestly the fact that everyone is struggling to understand the objective should tell you that the prompt is in dire need of rewording.

rewording: land a realistic house somewhere in the solar system other than kerban. like a kerbal version of this:https://www.google.com/search?q=house&espv=2&biw=1280&bih=662&source=lnms&tbm=isch&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwjk7MaJ2qfSAhXrrVQKHRK5APoQ_AUIBigB#tbm=isch&q=house&chips=q:house 

Edited February 24, 2017 by rockets-don't-make-toast
You say realistic, but kerbals have always lived in hitchhiker containers. Anything else would just look silly to them.

Hm... I don't know why, but I kinda want to see this happen. If someone builds a house in the VAB, I'll put it on Eeloo. Just keep it under 200tons, and please make sure it can structurally handle a 2g launch. I can arrange to launch vertical and slow, so aerodynamics won't be the biggest of deals. I can even almost guarantee that most of it will arrive in mostly one piece! Mostly...
First attempt, had to cheat:

even so, you hold the record for this challenge. good job

 

for being the first to prove they done it.

Edited March 4, 2017 by rockets-don't-make-toast

Never before have I needed to repost a post as much as this post needed reposting!

Within it, the Mun is adorned with bafflingly beautiful buildings from many different creators.

Huge props to @EBOSHI for hosting the event (if I understood correctly) and compiling the extraordinary entries. The text reads:
(and pardon the rough translation, it's flexing muscles I haven't stretched in years)

"While planning this, I thought it might have been a little crazy, but we got to enjoy many people's creations."
 

Edited March 18, 2017 by Cunjo Carl
I love this challenge. Too bad I suck at building stuff like that.

37 minutes ago, joshudson said:

I love this challenge. Too bad I suck at building stuff like that.

Only way to get good at something is to just do it! I don't think anyone starts off being good at KSP still-life .

I landed a house on minmus for this.

It has good power generation and WiFi reception, and posseses a sizable interior. Has space for 6. I lowered it down with overhead rockets, which were detached after landing.And if the extraplanetary real estate buisness fails, it also doubles as a single launch surface lab, with a full range of scientific instruments.
I just leave it here :). (Not for challenge)
